intro: Sarcostoma, commonly known as the "sac-like mouth," is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Scrophulariaceae. These plants are characterized by their unique floral structures, which often feature specialized nectar-producing glands. Sarcostoma species are typically found in arid or semi-arid regions, adapting to harsh environmental conditions. Their leaves are often fleshy and succulent, aiding in water retention. The flowers are usually tubular or spurred, designed to accommodate specific pollinators such as bees or moths.
